item.title: Is DS-3 Bandwidth An Endangered Species?
item.description: For a long time, businesses needing a moderate amount of bandwidth have relied on DS-3 telecom services for dedicated internet access, file transfers, and video transport. While the price of DS-3 has been steadily decreasing due to increased competition, it might be approaching obsolescence. But why? The shift began when data packets replaced digitized voice as the dominant traffic on global networks, and now video demands a significant portion of available bandwidth.
